description: Vasily Kandinsky was a founding member of Blaue Reiter (Blue Rider), a loose alliance of artists based in Munich. Often working in a common palette and using expressive brushwork, they shared a belief in the symbolic and spiritual importance of forms and colors, including their effect on emotions and memories. Blaue Reiter also promoted a intuitive approach to painting, looking to non-Western, European medieval, and folk art for inspiration.
artist_info:
Vasily Kandinsky
Born Moscow (formerly Russian Empire
now Russia), 1866; died Neuilly-sur-Seine, France, 1944
title: Painting with Troika
